A8. MFA can reduce #cyberattacks by as much as 90%! It's a simple (though sometimes annoying to the user) procedure that can save an organization millions. @Marsh_MMA has a great piece on it here: https://t.co/wGEznLbTol #MMAChats #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth https://t.co/s0POjIeMZI
@tgravel @CISAgov Love the one Tina. #MMAChats

A7. #Cybersecurity training helps employees understand the depth of their risk, how to avoid such attacks and create a better understanding of what impact their actions can have in a breach. Part of that training must also impart compliance with policy. #MMAChats https://t.co/ITL2R8VBiZ

A6. Reducing #phishing attacks, #malware, etc. is largely a product of not only training employees what to do, and what not to do, but also enforcing those policies. Without enforcement what drives ALL employees to be truly careful with #cybersecurity? #MMAChats https://t.co/D1YqWjGRmj
@Patricia_Energy So true Patricia #MMAChats
100% Truth. @digitalcloudgal this to me is where one of the greatest #cybersecurity threats exists, a disengaged #CSuite. #MMAChats
Great share @jmwiersma #MMAChats

A5. To deal with #cybersecurity threats companies need to 1. recognize the risk, 2. plan, 3. take action to protect their data, 4. have a response plan, 5. strongly monitor their networks, 6. consider cyber #insurance, 7. Repeat! #MMAChats #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth https://t.co/FRnl7qBXBJ
@mscheincicclcs HAHAHA. #MMAChats

A4. I'd say, not what is the risk of private data ending up in the wrong hands (its very high), but what is the likelihood of it to be stolen multiple times? The # of access points to our private data are more numerous than we imagine. #MMAChats #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth https://t.co/iqG0vnlwKQ
@mscheincicclcs Well said Marc. #MMAChats
A key word not talked about enough outside of #cybersecurity practitioners @tcrawford when it comes to #data and #privacy... #Trust. #MMAChats

A3. Our most sensitive #data is our #healthcare information. New #health apps and #wearables offer significant #privacy and data risks. Not only companies but individuals need to be aware of the risk of their data to be stolen. #MMAChats #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth https://t.co/Ghj9QtCMwj
@Patricia_Energy Thank you Patricia. We are on the same page as usual.  ;) #MMAChats

Great points from @digitalcloudgal on #cybersecurity and #agriculture. We often forget of all the interdependencies and how a #cyberattack in one place can not only ripple across the industry but other areas as well. #MMAChats

A2b. In a #cyberattack on #agriculture look for a ransomware attack on a facility or the stealing of #data. By bringing an Ag processing facility or company down for even a short time, supply problems can have significant impact on markets. #MMAChats #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth https://t.co/IPMafvb2SV

A2a. The challenge is many people think of a #cyberattack, say perhaps in #agriculture as a hacker taking over a combine or tractor on auto drive, when the truth of the matter is the hack is more likely about #data. #MMAChats #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth https://t.co/ZXn0ZvUlMj

A8. Understanding what is in your #insurance policy is critical, especially before a #naturaldisaster hits. What is covered, what is not? Are there limitations in your policy? These are all things you need to know before, not after a catastrophe. #MMAChats https://t.co/VJwyJhqsHI
@Patricia_Energy Great point Patricia. #MMAChats

@jalloyd4 @jeffjjanes @Marsh_MMA Trying to figure out which I would prefer John...  :) #MMAChats
@AmandaJ91946253 @SydneyHedberg Couldn't agree more Amanda. #MMAChats

@Patricia_Energy YES! #MMAChats

A6. When rebuilding after a #naturaldisaster consider upgrading to higher standards of constructions and materials along with implementing risk mitigation options. https://t.co/XCfFG9o1vI #MMAChats https://t.co/4hlTXhuTHE
@GageGrammer @AmandaJ91946253 #TRUTH #MMAChats
@jalloyd4 @GageGrammer Scary and an unexpected level of flooding that isn't anticipated. #MMAChats

A5a. No matter your belief on the impact of #climatechange, simply the growth of human population and our taking over of natural environments is leading to greater risk of #naturaldisasters. Because of this I do believe we will see more disasters in the future. #MMAChats https://t.co/laGzLeCUiA

A5b. At the same time we may see a greater risk of #naturaldisaster, I do believe the greater use of #AI and sensing data will drive better management of #climate and disaster risk. I believe we are farther away from management though with mid-term growth in risk. #MMAChats https://t.co/juHgN7G0Ug
@Patricia_Energy @Cisco This is a great point Patricia on while #technology can't solve everything, it is good at breaking down barriers. #MMAChats

A4b. Additional #infrastructure improvements are additional seawall and offshore barrier systems to protect from #floods forestry management for #fire, along with mitigation and protection technologies. #MMAChat https://t.co/KKhljWlIlY
@jeffjjanes @Marsh_MMA 100% correct Jeff! #MMAChats
@GageGrammer Great idea Gage! You are right, there are very few plans thought out to what to do in an emergency, from individuals, to businesses and government. #MMAChats

A3. One of the easiest and least costly opportunities to reduce #flood and #naturaldisaster losses is simply preparation and having a disaster plan. One of those items of planning is having the correct #insurance policies in place, but also developing a recovery plan. #MMAChats https://t.co/q2vlqDngJe
@jalloyd4 Well said John. As humans we tend to be poor at forecasting future risk and tend to only react to current loss. #MMAChats
A great note by @SydneyHedberg of how #flood damage is often not included in insurance policies. Even if you aren't in a designated flood zone, floods still happen. #MMAChats

A2. Increasing #insurance coverage is the easiest way to cover risk of #flood and #fire. Not everyone can afford coverage so additional coverage backed by the government through the NFIP is also helpful. Updated risk ratings for flood prone areas are also beneficial. #MMAChats https://t.co/JxptESNmlb
@Patricia_Energy Unfortunately, it seems as if people and government won't take action on mitigation efforts, even small ones, until AFTER a disaster occurs. #MMAChats

@ATTBusiness Absolutely JC. There is a large number of clinicians and also people who need #mobile connectivity and the infrastructure for #virtualcare. This is a key element of crossing the #DigitalDivide. #BizTalks #Telehealth #ATTinfluencer

@ATTBusiness A5b. #AI is now examine test results, especially in radiology and often is more consistent then humans. Soon many of us will be recieving a #healthcare diagnosis and much more from machines. #BizTalks #Telehealth #ATTinfluencer https://t.co/yRjDu29lxV

@ATTBusiness A5a. We are at the tip of the iceberg of how #AI is impacting how #healthcare providers deliver patient care.
